Sentence: A police detective, Jerome Collet, calls Robert Langdon, the story's protagonist and a professor of symbology, and asks him (professor) to come to the Louvre to try to interpret the scene
At the Louvre, Langdon meets Jerome Collet and Bezu Fache, the police captain, and realizes that the two policemen suspect him (Langdon) of the murder
Vernet successfully smuggles Sophie and Langdon past Collet in the back of a locked armored car
Collet arrives at the castle, but Sophie, Langdon, the bound Silas, Teabing, and his (Langdon) servant, Rémy, escape and board Teabing's private plane to England
